intro: Ormosia howii, commonly known as the Hawaiian ormosia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces woody pods that contain several elliptical seeds. Ormosia howii is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and along stream banks. It plays an important ecological role in its native environment, providing habitat and food for various native species.
